title: Miss Fortune.
body: Even with the rework, I don't see her being played in ranked play. She's not much of a hyper carry like other snowballing adc are. Her biggest issue is her ultimate and passive if you ask me. Please remove the fact that minions can stop her passive (so she can trade and run away), and do something with her ultimate. Honestly you need to be hit by a decent amount of bullets for it to do anything, and when you're casting you're a sitting duck asking to be rushed by assassins and what not. Please do something, you nerfed her q size give her something in return!

The problem is, that it requires so much for you to get that 150% Q damage bounce onto a champion.

1 : MF has to be in the right position to Q a minion
2 : A minion has to be with 550 units of MF
3 : Minion has to be within kill range of the Initial Q bounce (which isn't much more than normal AA dmg)
4 : Enemy has to be within a 60 degree cone of the Minion and within 550 yards.  (60 deg is NOT very big)

So basically MF has to have great positioning, and the enemy has to be terrible and have ZERO clue how to position in order for MF's Q to land a 150% bounce.


Compared to other ADC's with lane poke, Caitlyn, Varus, Draven, Lucian, Point and Click line pokes that go THROUGH minions, none of the requirements that MF has to deal with

Jinx AoE AA's,  

Corki - Point and click Phos Bombs

I'd take more consistent poke/harass, then significantly harder to hit poke/harass.

I'm honestly surprised at how small the buffs were for how much power they took away from her kit.  MF losing her grievous wounds was pretty huge (that was the only reason why she was good at dueling other ADCs, and made her a very decent counterpick to high sustain comps), her grievous wounds was pretty much the only thing that kept her afloat.

That being said, I am glad that they removed the grievous wounds because it is a bad mechanic and makes it so that sustain has to be overpowered to have even a remote chance of dealing with grievous wounds, but giving her an extremely conditional damage boost (that was actually nerfed to be even _more_ conditional before) and an incredibly laughable buff to her attack speed boost that allows her to get her passive yet again (which she can just immediately lose it from a minion sneezing on her).


Riot should go back to the drawing board on this one, MF is going to need some serious work before she can even _remotely_ be considered a T1 ADC.

Also, the fact that Riot called her a T1 ADC is so unbelievably laughable that it genuinely makes me question if they actually play their own game sometimes.

This is a big problem if you ask me.  In all actuality, for 99.44% of game circumstances.  

Q - Buff is so situational, that you MIGHT get 1 or 2 of them off during the laning phase, but its definitely not a mechanic that can be counted upon to be available when you need it.  Oh almost forgot, they narrowed the bounce cone of Q from 100 deg, to a 60 deg cone, so it's actually harder to get a Q bounce onto the right target now.

W - Applying Strut is basically a no change as well.  MF's W is an AS steroid, if your NOT using it to do more damage, you are using it wrong.  If you save it to apply strut while running away, you've just done LESS damage during an engage/encounter.  Congrats on being a bad ADC.

E - Still underwhelming, still extremely easily avoidable, still roots MF during the cast animation, still has a delay before it shows up, still only applies its slow incrementally in .25 sec intervals.  

R - Functionally unchanged for almost all purposes.  Its applied stacks of impure shots for a while now so nothing really new with her update.

So basically, after the update, we have Miss Fortune, who plays EXACTLY like old Miss Fortune...  except she doesn't have Grievous Wounds, and Q Bounce is harder to hit.

The Q bounce used to prioritize minions unless the enemy champ had a stack of impure shots. Now it just hits what ever is directly lined up. If there is nothing lined up, the cone widens to find more targets and goes back to the old priority listing. Q was made better.

For some reason, Riot are very afraid to buff Miss Fortune into viability zone. She is still currently outclassed by many other immobile ADC.

At the very least, they should put back the buff she was meant to receive on her W and remove the cancel on the passive from minions. Maybe this would finally help her.

Her E is also very underwhelming. One of her channel has to go. She is already immobile, she does not need two abilities that root her in place.

Not even sure that is worth the removal of grievous wounds. At least before she was great at dueling other ADC with life steal. Now why should we ever pick her?

I have zero clue why Riot refuses to directly address these problems.  As much as the recent patch helped her in QOL, she's still far from being viable.  The issue here, like most people said, is that Miss Fortune lacks a niche.  Literally every ADC does one of her jobs better.  Back when MF had GW, she may have been clunky and extremely hard to play well with how awful her Q was, but she at least had a niche as the anti-healer ADC.  She has no niche now.  Lane bully?  Caitlyn/Sivir do it better.  Fast ADC?  Vayne/Sivir/Lucian do it better.  Hypercarry?  Kog'Maw/Vayne/Twitch do it better.  AD burst caster?  Graves/Lucian/Corki do it better.

Here's how you properly fix MIss Fortune.


*     Remove minion and monster aggro disabling her passive at level 11.
*      Reduce Double Up's cast time with attack speed.
*     Add magic penetration per level of Impure Shots (2 / 4 / 6 / 8 / 10). Increase the attack speed scaling to 30 / 40 / 50 / 60 / 70%. Revert the cooldown reduction back to 16 seconds. Lower it by one second on damage from basic attacks and Double Up while the active is up.
*     Reduce the scaling of Impure Shots down to 5%, have the scaling increase per level of Bullet Time by 1%, and allow the magic damage to crit.
*     Change Bullet Time's scalings to 60 / 85 / 110. Lower the cooldown to 120 / 105 / 90.

With these changes, you turn Miss Fortune into an ADC unlike any other in League. A burst AD caster lane bully that transitions into a hybrid damage duelist and teamfight ADC late game.

Riot hit her hard with their changes. The Q and E changes were great, but removing Grievous Wounds stripped away a lot of dueling power she once had. Now other carries can duel her without a contest because she can no longer shut down their lifesteal/heal. All she has now is a measly aspd buff. Her ult is already very mediocre mid to late game.

Riot wont listen to us though. They never do. Everyone warned them about how much of a heavy impact it'd have on Miss Fortune by removing Grievous Wounds. It was all she really had going for her.
It was barely a rework and it was a hard nerf. Grievous wounds was most of her duelling power, and it was completely removed.

Her early game got buffed enough to make AP MF a little stronger so im ok with it.

I've won my last 3 ranked games with her against ADCs like Vayne and Kalista. She isn't in as bad of a spot as everyone makes her out to be. If you know how to use her, abuse her extra q damage, and position her ult then she can be really powerful. Also if you find the right supports to match with her like Nami, Blitz, Thresh, etc. and they know what they are doing too then you really shouldn't be in that bad of a spot most of the time.

The one thing I do agree with is that minion damage not being effected after a certain level is a huge thing that has been asked for countless times and would help out if her passive didn't go off because of it after level 9 or 11. Making her W activate her passive right away and using it as an escape has probably only saved me about 2 or 3 times so far (and this was with no minions around going through the jungle). Instead it's basically just like before in team fights but without grievous wounds and only her AS buff.

You fire her Q at a minion and run away as it is bouncing to a second target. Not fire Q at minion, wait for it to hit, then run.

Either way, I've played her ranked and got from S2 to G5. Could maybe do more, but don't really feel like it.
